controlling_idea.description: A sentence on how and why lives undergo change in the story

act_count.description: The number of acts in the story

period.description: The period of the story world

duration.description: The duration in the story world

locations.description: The locations of the story world

conflict.description: The position of the story in the hierarchy of human conflict

devices.description: A literary device of the story

name.description: The full name of the character

role.description: The role of the character (e.g., protagonist, antagonist, etc.)

prominance.description: The prominance of the character in the story: Minor (i.e., bit part), Moderate (i.e., supporting), or Major (i.e., protagonist, antagonist)

characterization.description: The observable qualities of the character apparent in exposition

true_character.description: The true qualities of the character that are revealed through choices under pressure

conscious_desire.description: The conscious desire of the character (e.g., could be physical, situational, or attitudinal)

unconscious_desire.description: The unconscious desire of the character, at odds with their conscious desire

state_progression.description: The changing states of the character over time. Each entry is a comma-separated list of the values describing the character's state at successive points in time (e.g., [free, unskilled fighter], [captive, training fighter], [escaped, skilled fighter]). The first entry is the character's state at the beginning of the story, and the last entry is the character's state at the end of the story. Each value of the character's state should undergo an absolute and irreversible change by the end of the story. Only include values that change over the course of the story.

relationships.description: An interpersonal relationship of the story

first_character.description: The first character of the relationship (full name)

second_character.description: The second character of the relationship (full name)

relationship_nature.description: The nature of the relationship between the characters

prominance.description: The prominance of the relationship in the story: Minor, Moderate, or Major

state_progression.description: The changing states of the relationship over time. Each entry is a comma-separated list of the values describing the relationships's state at successive points in time (e.g., [acquaintances, distrusting], [adversaries, disrespecting], [allies, respecting]). The first entry is the relationships's state at the beginning of the story, and the last entry is the relationships's state at the end of the story. Each value of the relationship's state should undergo an absolute and irreversible change by the end of the story. Only include values that change over the course of the story.
